title: Local obituary: Bruce Higgins, 51, West Roxbury dad, prolific youth sports coach, and Boston cop
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Bruce Higgins Jr., 51, a West Roxbury resident and Boston police officer, passed away after a six-year battle with Melanoma.
Higgins was a dedicated coach, influencing numerous youths through Parkway sports and coaching at Catholic Memorial High School.
He is survived by his wife Lori, two children, and extended family; funeral services are on November 10 in West Roxbury.

title: MSPCA-Angell appeals for help as pet food demand surges during SNAP hold
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: MSPCA-Angell reports increased demand for pet food as SNAP benefits remain on hold since November 1.
The nonprofit is expanding food pantries in areas like Lawrence and Boston, facing resource strain.
MSPCA-Angell needs $6,000 extra weekly for 22,000 more meals; donations can be made via wish lists.

title: GBH lays off 15 employees in fourth wave of cuts this year
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: GBH laid off 15 employees this week due to financial challenges, marking the fourth round of layoffs this year.
The layoffs affected staff involved in content projects and support roles like marketing, finance, and IT departments.
In 2025, GBH has laid off nearly 70 employees, impacted by federal funding cuts and additional financial pressures.

title: Police: Uber driver strangled with wire, carjacked in Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A Dorchester man assaulted an Uber driver in Boston using a wire and carjacked her vehicle on Thursday.
Police tracked the stolen vehicle using the driver's phone and arrested Christopher Dawkins, 24, in Boston.
Dawkins faces charges including carjacking, strangulation, and larceny; arraignment scheduled in Boston Municipal Court.

title: ‘It was obvious’: Lucas Giolito not surprised Red Sox didn’t extend him qualifying offer
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Lucas Giolito did not receive a $22.05 million qualifying offer from the Red Sox due to end-of-season injury concerns.
Giolito, who missed the playoffs with elbow soreness, expressed surprise but understanding at the Red Sox's decision.
Despite entering free agency, Giolito stated a strong desire to return to Boston and continue playing for the Red Sox.

title: Yellow and lime green, this $4.8M Provincetown house was an artists’ retreat: ‘A house with a soul’
author: Lindsay Crudele
bullets: Ronny Hazel's Provincetown house is listed for $4.8 million, known for its vibrant colors and artist-built features.
The home at 4 Center St. served as an artistic retreat, featuring a sculpture garden and eclectic interior.
The property, built in 1870, offers waterviews, four bedrooms, and is close to the beach in Provincetown.

title: Meet Jennifer Coolfridge — Brookline’s community fridge fighting food insecurity
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Jennifer Coolfridge, a community fridge in Brookline, offers free food to residents affected by SNAP payment issues.
Partnering organizations like Brookline For the Culture and local businesses restock the fridge weekly with fresh and non-perishable items.
The fridge restricts certain foods to accommodate dietary needs and is supported by community donations and volunteer efforts.

title: What the Patriots’ Carlton Davis said about returning to Tampa
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Patriots cornerback Carlton Davis returns to Tampa Bay for the first time since leaving the Buccaneers.
Davis signed with the New England Patriots after playing six years with Tampa Bay, contributing to their Super Bowl win.
Injuries weaken Buccaneers' offense as the Patriots, led by Davis's experience, aim to extend their winning streak.

title: Need a cozy book recommendation? Take our quiz.
author: Annie Jonas and Kelly Chan
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to help readers find their ideal cozy book for fall and winter.
The quiz suggests books across genres, including literary fiction, romance, fantasy, mystery, and horror.
Readers can retake the quiz multiple times to receive different cozy book recommendations.

title: Get the ultimate guide to cozy reading
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Boston.com launches a free Cozy Books newsletter offering five days of curated reading recommendations.
The newsletter features handpicked books from small-town charm to gothic mystery, curated by local booksellers and writer Annie Jonas.
Subscribers receive daily emails exploring different cozy genres, designed to enhance comfort and warmth during cooler months.
